info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL HAMILTON, BUTLER, NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND SOUTHERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Williamsdale, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Miamisburg, Lebanon, Forest Park, Springboro, Sharonville, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale, Bellbrook, Carlisle, South Middletown, West Chester, West Carrollton, Ross and Seven Mile. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 18 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
